HALIFAX -- 
Nova Scotia is reporting one new case of COVID-19 on Monday, as the active number of cases in the province rises to 37.

articles.author: The Canadian Press, By Danielle Edwards and Michael MacDonald
articles.title: Nova Scotia Premier Iain Rankin calls summer election with vote set for Aug. 17 - CTV News Atlantic
articles.description: Nova Scotia Premier Iain Rankin has called a provincial election for Aug. 17, saying the campaign will focus on building the economy after the province "crushed" the third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.
articles.content:

articles.author: The Canadian Press, Sarah Plowman, By Danielle Edwards
articles.title: N.S. election: Liberals promise to cut some tolls on Trans-Canada Highway to N.B - CTV News Atlantic
articles.description: Nova Scotia Liberal Leader Iain Rankin had to overcome hecklers Tuesday as he announced his party would remove some tolls on a section of the Trans-Canada Highway.
articles.content:
AMHERST, N.S. --
